body: I've managed to address the issue by modifying the line to: ``` [[ docs[pageNumber].text ]] ``` I've noticed you have an issue with vue regarding the spacing of in-line content. Vue is preserving the spacing of the content within the template so changing the above line to something like ``` [[ docs[pageNumber].text ]] ``` Causes the text to become indented when rendered in the html page.

issue.title: Support importing datasets in JSON format

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Currently in order to upload a dataset for annotation all of the documents in the dataset must be in a single txt file with each document separated by a newline character like so:
```
document 1 text
document 2 text
```
It would be very helpful if instead documents could be within separate files and a bulk upload could be performed.  For example:

**Document 1**
```
Document
1
text
```

**Document 2**
```
Document
2
text
```

This would also allow documents to contain newline characters which was requested here: #12 

Love the tool!

body: Thanks for your code, @Zerthick. I test it and it works well for document classification task and seq2seq task while annotating. But the exporting csv file will render the newline and this will cause one sentence seperate to two lines. In order to avoid this situation, I will provide the option to export json file. #15

issue.title: Render line breaks in sequence labelling task

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
### System information
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux
- **Python version**: 3.6/3.7

### Describe the problem
White space is visually collapsed in samples of the sequence labelling task by use of `white-space: normal`, whereas all other tasks have `white-space: pre-wrap`.

This makes it virtually impossible to annotate anything that is not a single sentence. Since short sequences tend to not contain many line breaks anyway (and even if they did, it wouldn't hurt), but line breaks are required for annotating longer texts, I suggest using `pre-wrap` for all labelling tasks. Right now, the interface is only useful for annotating individual words in shorter sequences.
